agent.name: Special Collections Research Center, The George Washington University

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Preservation copy: Lock 30 (Brunswick, Maryland). Lock was extended upstream in the 1870's to accommodate an extra boat through the lock to expedite locking through time. Of the extended locks, most were extended downstream which was a much simpler conversion to this type lock. Note also the pivot (swing).

mods.mods:note: Special Collections Research Center, The George Washington University, 2130 H Street NW, Washington, 20052, United States of America (https://library.gwu.edu/scrc/contact)

div.LABEL: Preservation copy: Lock 30 (Brunswick, Maryland). Lock was extended upstream in the 1870's to accommodate an extra boat through the lock to expedite locking through time. Of the extended locks, most were extended downstream which was a much simpler conversion to this type lock. Note also the pivot (swing).

Preservation copy: Lock 30 (Brunswick, Maryland). Lock was extended upstream in the 1870's to accommodate an extra boat through the lock to expedite locking through time. Of the extended locks, most were extended downstream which was a much simpler conversion to this type lock. Note also the pivot (swing).
